newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean court says to protect Hanbo.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean court says to protect Hanbo.

text.p: A South Korean court said on Friday it had decided to protect the debt-ridden Hanbo Steel Co and its affiliate Hanbo Corp from creditors.
An official at Seoul District Court said the decision was made to limit adverse effects on the economy from the failure of the companies.
The court said all assets of the two companies would be frozen until the court rules on their applications for court receivership.
Hanbo Steel filed for receivership on Tuesday after piling up about five trillion won of loans from 61 banks and finanical institutions.
Government officials said Hanbo's trouble stemmed from excessive investment in building a steel mill in the southern city of Tanjin.
